args.content:
import Mathlib

open Filter Asymptotics

variable {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace ‚Ñù E]

/-- Suppose f : E ‚Üí ‚Ñù is differentiable at x0. Then the error
    |f(x0+h) - f(x0) - Df(x0) h| is bounded by the operator norm times ‚Äñh‚Äñ plus a smaller-order term.
    Formally we express this by saying the difference between the left-hand side and
    ‚ÄñDf(x0)‚Äñ * ‚Äñh‚Äñ is little-o of ‚Äñh‚Äñ as h ‚Üí 0. -/
theorem differentiable_at.error_bound_opnorm (f : E ‚Üí ‚Ñù) {x0 : E} (hf : DifferentiableAt ‚Ñù f x0) :
  IsLittleO (fun h => |f (x0 + h) - f x0 - (fderiv ‚Ñù f x0 : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù) h| - ‚Äñ(fderiv ‚Ñù f x0 : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù)‚Äñ * ‚Äñh‚Äñ)
          (fun h => ‚Äñh‚Äñ) (ùìù (0 : E)) := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Filter Asymptotics

variable {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace ‚Ñù E]

/-- Suppose f : E ‚Üí ‚Ñù is differentiable at x0. Then there exists a remainder r(h) = o(‚Äñh‚Äñ)
    such that for all h one has
    |f(x0+h) - f(x0) - Df(x0) h| ‚â§ ‚ÄñDf(x0)‚Äñ * ‚Äñh‚Äñ + r(h).
    This formalizes the statement that the error is bounded by the operator norm times the step
    plus a smaller-order term. -/
theorem differentiable_at.error_bound_opnorm (f : E ‚Üí ‚Ñù) {x0 : E} (hf : DifferentiableAt ‚Ñù f x0) :
  ‚àÉ r : E ‚Üí ‚Ñù, IsLittleO r (fun h => ‚Äñh‚Äñ) (ùìù (0 : E)) ‚àß
    ‚àÄ h, |f (x0 + h) - f x0 - (fderiv ‚Ñù f x0 : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù) h| ‚â§ ‚Äñ(fderiv ‚Ñù f x0 : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù)‚Äñ * ‚Äñh‚Äñ + r h :=
by
  -- We provide only the statement; the proof is omitted.
  sorry

open Filter Asymptotics

variable {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace ‚Ñù E]

/-- If f : E ‚Üí ‚Ñù is differentiable at x0, then the remainder
    f(x0+h) - f(x0) - Df(x0) h is little-o of ‚Äñh‚Äñ as h ‚Üí 0. -/
theorem differentiable_at.error_bound_opnorm (f : E ‚Üí ‚Ñù) {x0 : E} (hf : DifferentiableAt ‚Ñù f x0) :
  IsLittleO (fun h => |f (x0 + h) - f x0 - (fderiv ‚Ñù f x0 : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù) h|) (fun h => ‚Äñh‚Äñ) (ùìù (0 : E)) := by
  -- proof omitted

/-- If f : E ‚Üí ‚Ñù is differentiable at x0, then the remainder
    f(x0+h) - f(x0) - Df(x0) h is little-o of ‚Äñh‚Äñ as h ‚Üí 0. -/
theorem differentiable_at_error_bound_opnorm (f : E ‚Üí ‚Ñù) {x0 : E} (hf : DifferentiableAt ‚Ñù f x0) :
  IsLittleO (fun h => |f (x0 + h) - f x0 - (fderiv ‚Ñù f x0 : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù) h|) (fun h => ‚Äñh‚Äñ) (ùìù (0 : E)) := by

import Mathlib

variable {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace ‚Ñù E]

/-- Suppose f : E ‚Üí ‚Ñù is differentiable at x0. Then there exists a remainder r(h) = o(‚Äñh‚Äñ)
    such that eventually (for h near 0) we have
    |f(x0+h) - f(x0) - Df(x0) h| ‚â§ ‚ÄñDf(x0)‚Äñ * ‚Äñh‚Äñ + r(h).
    This expresses that the error is bounded by the operator norm times the step plus a smaller-order term. -/
theorem differentiable_at_error_bound_opnorm (f : E ‚Üí ‚Ñù) {x0 : E} (hf : DifferentiableAt ‚Ñù f x0) :
  ‚àÉ r : E ‚Üí ‚Ñù, (‚àÄ·∂† h in ùìù (0 : E), |f (x0 + h) - f x0 - (fderiv ‚Ñù f x0 : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù) h| ‚â§ ‚Äñ(fderiv ‚Ñù f x0 : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù)‚Äñ * ‚Äñh‚Äñ + r h) ‚àß
    IsLittleO r (fun h => ‚Äñh‚Äñ) (ùìù (0 : E)) := by
  sorry

  IsLittleO (fun h => |f (x0 + h) - f x0 - (fderiv ‚Ñù f x0 : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù) h|) (fun h => ‚Äñh‚Äñ) (ùìù (0 : E)) := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace ‚Ñù E]

/-- A conservative formalization: if f has a Fr√©chet derivative at x0, then the error
    f(x0+h) - f(x0) - Df(x0) h is bounded by ‚ÄñDf(x0)‚Äñ‚Äñh‚Äñ plus a smaller-order term (here taken as ‚Äñh‚Äñ^2).
    The proof is omitted. -/
theorem jirilebl_ra_ch_several_vars_ders_2621 (f : E ‚Üí ‚Ñù) {x0 : E}
  (hf : HasFDerivAt f (fderiv ‚Ñù f x0) x0) :
  ‚àÄ h, |f (x0 + h) - f x0 - (fderiv ‚Ñù f x0 : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù) h| ‚â§ ‚Äñ(fderiv ‚Ñù f x0 : E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] ‚Ñù)‚Äñ * ‚Äñh‚Äñ + ‚Äñh‚Äñ ^ 2 := by
  sorry
